Job DescriptionThe Technical Product Owner Tech PO is responsible for maximizing the value of the product resulting from the work of the development team. This role involves close collaboration with the Product Manager, Business Owners, and development teams to translate high-level product vision and strategy into actionable user technical stories and tasks. The Technical Product Owner ensures that the team understands the product requirements and works to deliver high-quality increments that meet business needs.TPO‚Äôs are needed (instead of PO‚Äôs) where products are highly technical and require frequent ‚ÄòTech Enablers‚Äô to drive business features. Key Responsibilities Backlog Management:  Own and manage their assign team‚Äôs user stories within the product backlog, ensuring it is up to date, prioritized (based on stakeholder feedback, business value, and changing requirements); and aligned with the product roadmap and strategic direction set by the Product Manager. Write clear, concise, and actionable technical user stories with well-defined acceptance criteria, definition of ready and definition of done. Continuously refine the backlog within the team members (Architect, tech leads, developers, QA Testers). Estimate technical user stories based on story points (effort, uncertainty, and complexity) to define capacity per iteration. Technical PO Background (Important to have) Product Development with CSPs (AWS, Azure, GCP). Knowledge of Cloud concepts, IaaS, PaaS and SaaS. Provide technical guidance and leadership to engineering teams, ensuring that technical solutions are aligned with product requirements and business goals. Work under agile frameworks and methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe), managing planning, reviews, refinements and grooming. Collaborate with Technology Solutions Architects and Integration Engineers to design and implement technically feasible solutions. Review and understand technical designs, ensuring they meet quality standards and align with the product vision. Review product increments to ensure they meet the technical design, customer-required functionality, safety, quality standards and documentation. Strong hands on managing technical user stories focus on the process (Development, Code Review, Testing, SecOps, review -UAT, deployment and release). Knowledge of non-functional vs functional requirements. Managing definitions and priorities under high uncertainty environments. Stakeholder Collaboration:  Work closely with the Product Manager to understand the product vision, priorities, futures, strategy, manage of technical information, and goals. Engage with Engineering teams, Architects and other stakeholders to gather technical requirements, feedback, and validate stories. Facilitate communication between stakeholders and the development team to ensure alignment. Sprint Planning and Execution:  Participate in sprint planning meetings to help the team understand the requirements and prioritize tasks. Ensure that the development team has a clear understanding of user stories and acceptance criteria. Provide timely feedback and clarification to the development team during sprints. Product Development and Delivery:  Collaborate with the development team to deliver high-quality product increments that meet the defined requirements. Conduct regular reviews and demos of completed work to gather feedback and ensure alignment with business needs. Ensure that delivered features meet the acceptance criteria and are ready for release. Continuous Improvement:  Monitor and evaluate product and agile performance using metrics and KPIs, and make data-driven decisions to improve the product. Participate in retrospectives and other continuous improvement activities to enhance team performance and product quality. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to inform product decisions. Documentation and Communication:  Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for user stories, features, and product requirements. Communicate progress, risks, and issues to the Product Manager and other stakeholders. Ensure that all relevant information is shared with the development team in a timely manner. Interfaces and Collaboration:  Product Managers:‚ÄØWork closely with Product Managers to ensure that the technical product backlog aligns with the overall product vision, strategy, and roadmap. Engineering Teams:‚ÄØCollaborate with engineering teams to ensure that technical solutions are aligned with product requirements and business goals, providing technical leadership throughout the development process. Business Owners:‚ÄØEngage with Business Owners to understand business priorities, gather technical requirements, and validate technical features. Technology Solutions Architects and Integration Engineers:‚ÄØWork with technical teams to ensure that technical solutions are feasible, scalable, and aligned with architectural standards. Stakeholders:‚ÄØFacilitate communication between stakeholders and technical teams to ensure alignment and gather feedback on technical product development.About UsInfosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.EEOInfosys provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race; color; sex; gender identity; sexual orientation; religious practices and observances; national origin; pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions; status as a protected veteran or spouse/family member of a protected veteran; or disability. The CompanyCapital Markets Gateway LLC (CMG) is a capital markets-focused fintech transforming global equity capital markets (ECM) through data, technology, and connectivity. As the preferred source for ECM analytics and the first network connecting the buy-side and sell-side for ECM workflows, we are committed to reshaping how capital markets operate. Founded in 2017 by a team of ECM practitioners, CMG has completed three successful fundraising rounds and is backed by a group of the world‚Äôs most prestigious financial institutions. The CMG platform is currently relied upon by nearly 150 buy-side firms representing $40 trillion in AUM and 22 global investment banks. For more information, please visit www.cmgx.io.The RoleWe‚Äôre looking for a Senior .NET Engineer to join our team to help build scalable, secure, and high-performing enterprise solutions for the financial industry.As a Senior .NET Engineer, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining robust backend systems and APIs that power our core products. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with frontend engineers, product managers, and QA teams to ensure seamless data flow, system reliability, and efficient service integration. Your contributions will include optimizing performance, enhancing system architecture, and applying best practices in software development, security, and deployment to support rapid and reliable product delivery.Our Engineering TeamThe CMG engineering team consists of domain experts who work collaboratively within a culture of cross-domain knowledge sharing. We value engineers who are passionate about modern technologies and best practices. Our engineers are encouraged to challenge the status quo and are constantly seeking improvement and efficiency in our code-base and platform. CMG engineers are empowered to explore solutions using bleeding edge technologies such as AI and bring recommendations to the table. We are in a period of making impactful engineering decisions. As part of our process, we believe in taking the time for research and prototyping - this is critical in making the right decisions. Given the experience of our team, we have naturally adopted best practices from local development, through code review and into production rollouts. Besides the standard pull requests, test automation, code coverage tracking, containerization, and one-click deployments, we are constantly reviewing these foundational components to develop new best practices.ResponsibilitiesDesign, develop, and maintain scalable backend services using .NET 9 and ASP.NET Core, and GraphQL Lead, drive, and own implementation of new solutions in the codebase and architecture Work independently with minimal direction, taking full ownership of assigned projects Identify opportunities for improvement in the codebase and take the lead in pushing for those changes Collaborate with distributed teams to deliver new product features and enhancements Write high-quality, well-tested code and contribute to automated testing frameworks using xUnit.net Build and Prototype solutions using AI tools such as GitHub Copilot (in JetBrains Rider), and Codex OpenAI Leverage technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Redis, RabbitMQ, GraphQL, and PostgreSQL to improve system reliability and performance Monitor, debug, and optimize applications using DataDog, Grafana, OpenTelemetry, and Microsoft Azure services Contribute to a strong engineering culture through code reviews, knowledge sharing, and continuous improvement Engage in agile development processes including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives. QualificationsC#, ASP.NET Core: 3+ years Software Engineering: 5+ Years Proven ability to lead and own technical solutions and architectural decisions Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision Write high-quality, well-tested code Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills (written and verbal) Enjoys team collaboration, continuous learning, and building scalable solutions Strive to constantly learn new things Must be based in LATAM English level - C1 or C2 Fintech experience is a plus Experience developing AI-powered applications is a plusOur Tech StackLatest .NET version for our backend services Federated GraphQL .NET server running in Hot Chocolate MassTransit and RabbitMQ for messaging Hangfire for our background processing Swashbuckle for swagger generation Redis Cache for distributed caching and real-time messaging Azure as infrastructure providerDocker + Kubernetes for microservice orchestration using Istio service mesh PostgreSQL for relational db, ElasticSearch for indexing, Redis for caching DataDog, Grafana and OpenTelemetry for observability GitHub for our Version Control and CI (with our own runners) React with TypeScript on our front-end AI Tools: GitHub Copilot (in Rider), Codex OpenAI for developing, prototyping and innovationOur ValuesWe innovate with purposeWe focus on outcomes vs. outputWe believe diverse and inclusive teams fuel innovationWe are humble yet candidWe do right by the customerWhat We Offer2+ years contract 15 business days of vacation Tech courses and conferences Top-of-the-line MacBook Fully remote working environment Flexible working hours CMG embraces our ongoing commitment to building a culture reflecting the people, perspectives, and passions it represents. We will accept nothing less than equity, inclusion, and belonging for all. With the only constant in life being change, we will always listen, learn, and improve for the betterment of our teams, customers, and communities. CMG is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.
